task: Two nearby lampposts are perpendicular to the ground, which is flat. One of the lampposts is 10 feet tall and has a shadow that is 7 feet long. At the same time, the shadow of the other lamppost is 3 feet long. How tall, in feet, is the other lamppost? (Assume that at a given point in time, the right triangles formed by the lampposts and their respective shadows are similar.)
explanation:
The correct answer is 4.29. Since the triangles are similar, the proportion is:
10/7 = x/3.
Solving for x gives: x = (10 × 3) / 7 = 4.29 feet.
